intro: Fumana laevis f. genuina, commonly known as the smooth fumana, is a variant of the fumana plant characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves. This plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It typically grows in temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their mild aromatic properties. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value.
